div.head: Introduction
div.p: This section describes how to produce a customization of the TEI stylesheets. It describes all the parameters which you can set, the templates which are designed to be changed, and the empty templates provided into which you can add your own code.

There are 13 areas for customization. In most cases there are parameters and templates which are specific to one of the three output methods (HTML, FO and LaTeX), and those which are common to all three.

div.head: Making HTML: example
div.p:
You can simply refer to the specification xhtml2/tei.xsl directly with your XSL processor, or install it locally on your own server. For more flexibility, you may prefer to reference the specifications from an XSL wrapper of your own. The minimal specification would look like this:
<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:import href="xhtml2/tei.xsl"/> </xsl:stylesheet>
You can customize the result by adding to this wrapper file. The normal result will be a single stream of HTML which you can save in a file. You can also configure it to produce multiple output files, one per top-level div or div1.

div.head: Standard page features
div.p: The default behaviour of the system is to construct each HTML page with per-page navigation bars top and bottom, and a standard set of navigation links underneath.

row.cell: Name of link to home page of application [string]
How to align the navigation panel at the bottom of the page [string]
Display navigation panel at bottom of pages [boolean]
Fixed string to insert before normal page title in HTML meta <title> element [string]
Make a panel with next page/previous page links. [boolean]

div.head: Layout
div.p: There are three ways to provide a constant navigation aid. You can either make the whole page into a table, where the first column has a table of contents, or you can make an HTML frameset, or you can just have a table of links on the left or right

Hypertext links present special problems, as we have to choose whether they should start a new window, occupy all of the current window, or stay within the frame. These stylesheets implement the following rules:
Any ref or ptr link stays within the frame
Any link containing :// uses the whole browser window
Any link starting . uses the whole browser window
If the stylesheet sets no splitting of the document, any ref or ptr link uses the whole browser window
If a ref or ptr link has a rend attribute value of noframe, the whole browser window is used
If a ref or ptr link has a rend attribute value of new, a new browser window is started

row.cell: Whether to make simplified display of ODD [boolean]
Whether we should construct a separate file for each page (based on page breaks) [boolean]
When making fixed format epub, width of viewport [number]
When making fixed format epub, height of viewport [number]
Link back from footnotes to reference [boolean]

How to use the front/body/back matter in creating columns.
The choice is between all: use <front> for left-hand column, use <body> for centre column, and use <back> for right-hand columnbody: use <body> for right-hand column, generate left-hand with a TOC or whatever
[string]

The difference between TEI div levels and HTML. headings. TEI <div>s are implicitly or explicitly numbered from 0 upwards; this offset is added to that number to produce an HTML <Hn> element. So a value of 2 here means that a <div1> will generate an <h2> [integer]
Make a separate file for footnotes [boolean]
Width of left-hand column when $pageLayout is "Table" [string]
XML resource defining a navigation bar. The XML should provide a <list> containing a series of <item> elements, each containing an <xref> link. [anyURI]
Put back matter in multiple columns [boolean]

When processing a "pb" element, decide what to generate: "active" generates a page break; "visible" genrates a bracketed number (with scissors), and "bracketsonly" generates a bracketed number (without scissors). [float]
When making a table, what width must be constrained to fit, as a proportion of the page width. [float]
Whether to number lines of poetry [boolean]
When numbering poetry, how often to put in a line number [integer]

div.head: Headings
div.p: Headings for sections can be customized in various ways.

row.cell: Construct a heading for <div> elements with no <head> [boolean]
Character to put after number of section header [string]

list.item:
(for common) [common] How to make a heading for section if there is no <head>
[
]
➤
(for common) Punctuation to insert after a section number .

div.head: Numbering
div.p: Section headings, figures, tables and notes can be numbered automatically. We can set the numbering of front matter and back matter separately. If you prefer to supply your own numbering, using the n attribute, you can choose this over automatic numbering.
Normally, heading numbers are followed by . , but you can vary this. This would let you use eg fixed spaces.

row.cell: Automatically number figures in back matter [boolean]
How to construct heading numbering in back matter [string]
Automatically number tables in back matter [boolean]
How to construct heading numbering in main matter [string]
Automatically number figures in front matter [boolean]
How to construct heading numbering in front matter [string]
Automatically number tables in front matter [boolean]
Depth to which sections should be numbered [integer]
Use value of "n" attribute to number sections [boolean]

list.item: (for common) [common] How to number sections in back matter
(for common) [common] How to number sections in main matter
(for common) [common] How to number sections in front matter

div.head: Output
div.p: You can set a name for the output file(s); if you ask for multiple output files, this name will be used to create unique filenames for each section. By default, results will go to wherever your XSLT processor normally writes (usually standard output). If you opt to have files created, you can specify the name of the directory where the output is to be placed.
If you are making HTML, do you want a single output page, or a separate one for each section of the document? You can decide to have a different splitting policy for front and back matter.

row.cell: The complete URL when the document is being delivered from a web server (normally set by Apache or Cocoon) [string]
An ID passed to the stylesheet to indicate which section to display [string]
A wrapper around the ID, to allow for other ways of getting it [string]
A path fragment to put before all internal URLs [string]
The name of the output file [string]
Directory in which to place generated files. [string]

The style of HTML (Simple, CSS or Table) which creates the layout for generated pages. The choice is between Simple: A linear presentation is createdCSS: The page is created as a series of nested <div>s which can be arranged using CSS into a multicolumn layoutTable: The page is created as an HTML table
[string]
Break back matter into separate HTML pages (if splitting enabled). [boolean]
Break front matter into separate HTML pages (if splitting enabled). [boolean]

Level at which to split sections. When processing a <div> or <div[0-5]>, compare the nesting depth and see whether to start a new HTML page. Since the TEI starts with <div1>, setting this parameter to 0 will cause top-level sections to be split apart. The default is not to split at all.
[integer]
Display navigation panel at top of pages. [boolean]
How to specify infra-document links. When a document is split, links need to be constructed between parts of the document. The default is to use a query parameter on the URL. [string]

Construct links using existing ID values. It is often nice if, when making separate files, their names correspond to the ID attribute of the >div<. Alternatively, you can let the system choose names. [boolean]

Name of intended XSL FO engine This is used to tailor the result for different XSL FO processors. By default, no special measures are taken, so there are no bookmarks or other such features. Possible values are
passivetex (the TeX-based PassiveTeX processor xep (XEP) fop (FOP) antenna (Antenna House)
[string]
URL root where referenced documents are located [string]
Whether or not to load LaTeX packages which attempt to process the UTF-8 characters. Set to "false" if you are using XeTeX or similar. [boolean]
Use real name of graphics files rather than pointers [boolean]

div.head: Table of contents generation
div.p: You probably want tables of contents built for your document, using the div structure. However, if you have used a divGen type="toc" explicitly, that will also create a table of contents, so you can suppress the automatic one. When a table of contents is created, you choose how many levels of headings it will show. You can choose whether or not the front and backmatter appear in the table of contents.

row.cell: Make an automatic table of contents [boolean]
CSS class for second-level TOC entries [string]

Depth at which to stop doing a recursive table of contents. You can have a mini table of contents at the start of each section. The default is only to construct a TOC at the top level; a value of -1 here means no subtoc at all. [integer]
Include the back matter in the table of contents. [boolean]
Depth to which table of contents is constructed. [string]
Include the front matter in the table of contents. [boolean]
Which HTML element to wrap each TOCs entry in. [string]
Which HTML element to wrap each TOC sections in. [string]
Text to link back to from foot of ODD reference pages [string]
URL to link back to from foot of ODD reference pages [anyURI]
Punctuation to insert after a section number in a TOC [string]
Page number on which TOC should start [integer]

div.head: Internationalization
div.p: At various places, the system has to create text. You can choose the words it uses (eg translate them to another language).

list.item: (for xhtml) [html] Make a copyright claimThis page is copyrighted

div.head: CSS
div.p: Setting up material for the CSS file to accompany HTML output.

row.cell: CSS class for links derived from <ptr> [string]
CSS class for links derived from <ref> [string]
CSS style file to be associated with output file(s) [anyURI]
CSS style file for print; this will be given a media=print attribute. [anyURI]
Secondary CSS style file; this will be given a media=screen attribute, so that it does not affect printing. It should be used for screen layout. [anyURI]
CSS file to include in the output file directly [anyURI]
Default colour for background of table cells which are labelling rows or columns [string]

list.item:
(for fo) [fo] Set attributes for display of table center italic
always

div.head: Figures and graphics
div.p: Sometimes you need to prefix the names of all graphics files with a directory name or a URL, or provide a default suffix. You can also tell figure elements whether or not to produce anything.

row.cell: Directory specification to put before names of graphics files, unless they start with "./" [string]
Default file suffix for graphics files, if not directly specified [string]
Resolution of images. This is needed to calculate HTML width and height (in pixels) from supplied dimensions. [integer]
How to scale figures if no width and height specified (pass to XSL FO content-width) [string]
Show the contents of <head> in a cross-reference to table or figure [boolean]
Show a title for figures or tables (eg Table or Figure) in a cross-reference [boolean]
Show the page number in a cross-reference to table or figure [boolean]

list.item: (for fo) [fo] Set attributes for display of figures center italic

div.head: Style
div.p:
You can choose lots of features which affect the font, size, etc
What font to use for URLs.
Whether titles, dates and authors are shown.
Whether headings of objects are included in cross-references.

div.head: Hooks
div.p: A set of templates which are empty by default; they can be used to add code at strategic points. The content must be valid XSLT.

list.item: (for common) [common] Hook where actions can be inserted when making a heading
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted just after <body>
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted just before the <body> ends. This can be used to add a page-wide footer block.
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where Javascript calls can be inserted just after <body>
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where extra CSS can be inserted
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where code can be added to the HTML <head>. This would be used to insert <meta> tags.
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted when creating an
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted when processing a figure
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where extra Javascript functions can be defined
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted just before the <address>
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted at the start of processing each section
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted at the beginning of the main text, after the header
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted after processing <TEI>
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted before processing <TEI>
(for xhtml) [html] Hook where HTML can be inserted when creating an <a> element
(for xhtml) [html] Hooks where HTML can be inserted when processing <egXML> element
(for fo) [fo] Hook where extra material can be inserted after the <body> has been processed
(for fo) [fo] Hook where work can be done at the start of each block
(for fo) [fo] Hook where extra page masters can be defined
(for latex) [latex] Hook where LaTeX commands can be inserted after the beginning of the document
(for latex) [latex] Hook where LaTeX commands can be at start of setup
(for latex) [latex] Hook where LaTeX commands can be inserted in the preamble before the beginning of the document

div.head: Miscellaneous and advanced
div.p: Finally, some miscellaneous or advanced features which you probably won't use much.

row.cell: The home page for these stylesheets [anyURI]
Process elements according to assumptions of TEI P4 [boolean]
Title, author and date is taken from the <teiHeader> rather than looked for in the front matter [boolean]
Whether to attempt to work out a current date (set to true for test results which won't differ [boolean]
Generate a unique ID for all paragraphs [boolean]
Character separating values in a rend attribute. Some projects use multiple values in rend attributes. These are handled, but the separator character must be specified. [string]
Show a title and author at start of document [boolean]
